description:
Jakub Nabaglo

Python has powerful tools that let our programs inspect and modify themselves. These can be used for good or evil. We study a few of these tools, and some examples of how not to use them.

https://2019.pycon-au.org/talks/what-not-to-do-and-how-to-do-it

PyCon AU, the national Python Language conference, is on again this August in Sydney, at the International Convention Centre, Sydney, August 24 - 28 2018.

Video licence: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 - https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/

Python, PyCon, PyConAU

Sun Aug  4 11:50:00 2019 at Cockle Bay
title: What not to do, and how to do it
